feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 11:46AM AKDT until October 24 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Additional snow accumulations one to two inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. South winds gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...Central Brooks Range.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with periods of low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of one inch. Visibility one half mile or less at times. West winds gusting to 55 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Baca County through 545 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Campo, or 21 miles north of Boise City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued October 24 at 2:49PM MDT until October 26 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 229 AND 230... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; Western Las Animas County Including Trinidad and Thatcher

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 3:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWEST GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours this afternoon. Winds will be east to southeast at up to 10 mph with gusts up to 15 mph. With dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bartow; Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Fannin; Floyd; Gilmer; Gordon; Murray; Pickens; Polk; Walker; Whitfield

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued October 24 at 3:42AM HST until October 24 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR BIG ISLAND SUMMITS... .Strong upper level winds associated with the low pressure system north of the state will produce wind advisory conditions over the summits today. These strong wind speeds at summit level will slowly decrease through the morning and afternoon hours.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 24 at 2:31PM MDT until October 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches for elevations above 7000 feet and 10 to 20 inches for elevations above 8000 feet. Isolated areas with higher amounts are possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 2:31PM MDT until October 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches in areas below 10000 feet. Higher peaks above 10000 feet can see higher amounts greater than a foot. Southern parts of the range will see less snow, with accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds
entry.cap:areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 2:31PM MDT until October 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches for elevations above 8000 feet. Isolated areas with higher amounts are possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Salt River and Wyoming Ranges.
